properties.media:imagetext:
• South San Francisco Chamber of Commerce
South San Francisco, San Mateo County, Calif.
Hon. Board of Supervisors
City and. County San rancisco
City Hall, San Franciscol Calif.
January 11, 1927-
JAN 12 1927
BOARD OF SUPERVISCES
SAN
LERK'SUESK
РЕКУ
FRANCISCO
Gentlemen:
Referring to our letter of December 22, 1926 submitting temporary
airport at South San Francisco,
the offer of this site was discussed at
a luncheon meeting of the Aerial Affairs Committee of the San francisco
Chamber of
Commerce at the Merchants Exchange Building on
Thursday, Jan.
6 at which luncheon the various groups of aviators were present, includ-
ing the Ixecutive Committee and President of the San rancisco Chapter
National Aeronautical Association and other groups of aviators appointed
by the San Francisco Chamber of Commerce, the Board of Supèrvisors being
represented by Messrs. James B. leSheehy, Milton Marks, Warren Shamon,
and Milo F. Kent.
The Aerial Affairs Committee of the San Francisco Chamber of Com-
merce read its
report recommending the temporary airport offered at
South San Francisco, which report was concurred in by all of the aviators.
The Supervisors present then requested information as to the terms and
conditions of the offer of the temporary field and at the same time re-
a uested
that it include an option on the proposed permanent site at South
San Francisco designated as Field No. 2 in the report of the San francisco
Chamber of Commerce.
We herewith attach you letter
just received from the South San Fran-
cisco Land & Improvement Company date January 10 containing the terms
and
conditions of the offer of the
temporary field and including an option on
Field No. 2 as suggested by the Supervisors.
The option is
based on the land value of Site No. 2 as presented to
the Airport Committee of the Board of Supervisors at its meetings on Oct.
11, pages 4-6 inclusive, and Oct. 25, pages 15-21 inclusive, at which
a letter of the South San Francisco Land and
time
Improvement Company addressed
to the South San Francisco Chamber of Commerce dated Oct, 8, 1926 submitted
Site No. 2 at a price of $520,000, which price includes
the filling of that
portion of the
field indicated in pink on the map attached thereto, total-
ing 100 acres, to an elevation of plus 10 ft; the Land Company to accept an
initial payment of $100,000 and immediately prepare the 100 acres parcel
the site, the balance of the amount to be spread over a period of 5
If there are any other details you wish regarding the temporary air-
port which has been offered at South San Francisco, please command us.
Yours very
SOUTH SAN F
PRT :BY
THE INDUSTRIAL CITY WHERE RAIL, RO
IMMERCE
transpion
